meshIneBits

Class Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • meshIneBits.Layer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Layer
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    A layer contains all the bit 3D for a given Z. These bits are organized following a PatternTemplate. In order to build the 3D bits, it has to start by building a Pavement for each slice. The flatPavement determines the position and orientation of the bits. It is then cloned and shaped to fit the linked Slice.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addBit

        public meshIneBits.util.Vector2 addBit(Bit2D bit,
                                       boolean b)
        Add a Bit2D to the flatPavement. Recalculate area of Bit2D and decide to add into flatPavement if it is inside border
        Parameters:
        bit - expressed in Project coordinate system
        b - true to notify observers
        Returns:
        the origin of the newly inserted bit in Project coordinate system. null if out of bound

      • moveBit

        public meshIneBits.util.Vector2 moveBit(Bit3D bit3D,
                                        meshIneBits.util.Vector2 direction)
        Move a bit. The distance of displacement will be determined in dependence on the pattern template. Not use in quick succession because after each move, the layer will be recalculated, slowing the process
        Parameters:
        bit3D - target
        direction - the direction in local coordinate system of the bit
        Returns:
        the new origin of the moved bit

        Move multiple bits at once.
        Parameters:
        bits - chosen bits
        direction - chosen way
        Returns:

        Scale a bit
        Parameters:
        bit - extruded bit
        percentageLength - of CraftConfig.lengthFull
        percentageWidth - of CraftConfig.bitWidth
        Returns:
        the key of the replaced bit. If percentageLength or percentageWidth is 0, the bit will be removed instead.
